Subject: Clarification on Policy Alignment and Reporting
Description:
Hi Team,

We have specific concerning the reporting of file transfers,Recently, we attempted to send a sample Excel file via Gmail. However, in the reports, the destination was shown as a "chrome destination" with the type listed as "webbrowser." We have a separate policy called report all files based on requirement we allow users to upload some specific contents but in this policy we could see file paths but unable to track whether its transfers via email or opened on web browser and this has led to some confusion.

Could you please provide guidance on how to accurately identify whether a user has transferred a file via email or simply opened it through a web browser? Understanding this distinction is crucial for ensuring our policies are correctly aligned and our reporting is accurate
What_We_Know__c:
The customer enabled the DPI but the EPP network extension was not enbaled for the machines. 
They have the steps on how to install and enable the EPP network extension and they should use an MDM tool in order to enable the network extension for all the computers.
Solution_Comment__c: What the customer reported was not actually an issue, it was the way that the EPP Client works.
Account_Name__c: Kannan International Pvt Ltd. (former BrainValley Software Private Limited)
